starwars.entities.actors

Class Droid

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Entity
      • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Actor<SWActionInterface>
        • starwars.SWActor
          • starwars.entities.actors.Droid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityInterface, SWEntityInterface

    public class Droid
extends SWActor
    Class for Droid SWActors Droids are non human SWActors able to follow the player if taken ownership of. Droid, like all SWActors also have a certain amount of hitpoints that renders them ï¿½mmobile if falling below zero. It is to this need then that the Droid can be dismantled into Droid Parts - and then re-assembled by using these parts. Droids also are ownable - thus, if a player comes across a neutral affiliated Droid, they can take up their ownership. Droids do NOT use the Force, so they are essentially the owners' companions!
    Author:
    rober_000, jas, mewc

    • Constructor Detail

      • Droid

        public Droid(int hitpoints,
             java.lang.String name,
             MessageRenderer m,
             SWWorld world,
             Direction[] droidPath)
        Constructor for a Droid. Droids are initially of NEUTRAL affiliation. Taking ownership of a Droid changes their allegience.
        Parameters:
        hitpoints - the number of hit points of this Droid has. If this decreases to below zero, the Droid will become immobile
        name - the Droids name. Used in displaying descriptions.
        m - MessageRenderer to display messages.
        world - the SWWorld world to which this Droid belongs to

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        act() method for Droids Implements the Droids' actions - which if a regular Droid, is essentially moving around in a random fashion (20%) chance each turn. Droids can heal themselves if they are below half their health - if they come accross a oil can they have picked up. Once taken ownership, Droids follow their new owner until they are once again immobile. On repair, Droids take on their owners allegiance, so be wary!
        Specified by:
        act in class Actor<SWActionInterface>

      • getShortDescription

        public java.lang.String getShortDescription()
        getShortDescription() method for Droids Returns the short string description of a Droid. This is based on the basis of a Droid - if it is either C-3PO or R2-D2, the function returns specialized descriptions matching their functions. Otherwise for regular Droids, the return is the same - " the Droid ".
        Specified by:
        getShortDescription in interface EntityInterface
        Overrides:
        getShortDescription in class Entity
        Returns:
        description - The Droids' short description in String format

      • getLongDescription

        public java.lang.String getLongDescription()
        getLongDescription() method for Droids Returns the short string description (as this.getShortDEscripton) of a Droid. This is based on the basis of a Droid - if it is either C-3PO or R2-D2, the function returns specialized descriptions matching their functions. Otherwise for regular Droids, the return is the same - " the Droid ".
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Returns:
        short descripton - The Droids' short descripton in String format

      • getOwner

        public SWActor getOwner()
        getOwner() method for Droids Returns the SWActor owner the Droids currently. If the Droid does not have a owner, this function returns null.
        Returns:
        owner - The Droids' SWActor owner at present runtime.

      • setOwner

        public void setOwner(SWActor newOwner)
        setOwner() method for Droids Initiates the SWActor owner of the Droid that will take owner of said Droid. This method also sets the humanControlled variable to true.
        Parameters:
        newOwner - - The new owner (SWActor) of the Droid
